data.message: Dear Facebook, I reported a page that is straight up offensive to people with a certain condition and you said that it did not violate any of your standards.  SERIOUSLY?  The page should be taken down and removed right now.  Also, I don't want to provide my cell phone number!

replies.message: Hi Andy. Because of the diversity of our community, it's possible that something could be disagreeable or disturbing to you without meeting the criteria for being removed or blocked. For this reason, we also offer personal controls over what you see, such as the ability to hide or quietly cut ties with people, Pages, or applications that offend you. Learn how at: http://on.fb.me/Wnt9YP  -Ryan

Exactly I have a Protective Order against someone who continues to slander and post things. They will not remove the posts. yet last time I sent them a copy of the court order and they removed them. The keep ignoring me on this post Facebook
Just because you stop it from being in your newsfeed does not stop it from being offensive and harassing

Samoin sensurointia voisi järkeistää??
Eikä olla niin jumalattoman tiukkia jos joku vaikka saataisikin ? Esim arvostella Kataista tai Stubbia ? Ihmiset saa sen kuvan että face nuolee politiikkojen ?? Siis en sano tai sensuroitte vielä nää asia viestitkin!
Well Facebook, it's because of your diversity that you don't take down a page calling for harm to someone? Yeah ok that makes a lot of sense. Well while your at it fix m.facebook.com.
I received the same response when I reported someone whom I believed was using hate speech towards President Obama; they even used the word hate along with the N word...hmmm!

They do tend to ignore a lot of the reports. Even when a page set up by someone who was previously blocked by a lot of people for the bullying continues the bullying. They don't seem to care. There used to be a way to see who created a page and the page administrators so if they were being abusive, you could just report the people who ran it. But they no longer have that functionality.
